intro: Loranthella schimperi, commonly known as the African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and relies on its host for water and some nutrients, while producing its own carbohydrates through photosynthesis. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain sticky seeds that are dispersed by birds. Loranthella schimperi is often found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa.
